member.summary: Benchmark the TransformKey method. Within ms, random keys will be transformed and the number of performed transformations are returned.
member.param: Test duration in ms.

Stepping. The returned number of transformations will be a multiple of this parameter or uint.MaxValue. should be a prime number. For fast processors (PCs) a value of 3001 is recommended, for slower processors (PocketPC) a value of 401 is recommended.

member.summary: Represents an in-memory encrypted string.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a new protected string object. Protection is disabled by default! You need to call the EnableProtection member function in order to enable the protection, if you wish the string to be protected.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct a new in-memory encrypted string object.
member.param: If this parameter is true, the string will be protected in-memory (encrypted). If it is false, the string will be stored as plain-text.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Construct a new protected string. The string is initialized to the value supplied in the parameters.
member.param: If this parameter is true, the string will be protected in-memory (encrypted). If it is false, the string will be stored as plain-text.
The initial string value. This parameter won't be modified.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Construct a new protected string. The string is initialized to the value supplied in the parameters (UTF-8 encoded string).
member.param: If this parameter is true, the string will be protected in-memory (encrypted). If it is false, the string will be stored as plain-text.
The initial string value, encoded as UTF-8 byte array. This parameter won't be modified.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.#ctor(KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString)
member.summary: Construct a new protected string. The string is initialized to the value passed in the pbTemplate protected string.
member.param: The initial string value. This parameter won't be modified. Must not be null.
member.exception: Thrown if the input parameter is null.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.#ctor(System.Boolean,KeePassLib.Security.XorredBuffer)
member.summary: Construct a new protected string. The string is initialized to the value passed in the XorredBuffer object.
member.param: Enable protection or not.
XorredBuffer object containing the string in UTF-8 representation. The UTF-8 string must not be null-terminated.
member.exception: Thrown if the input parameter is null.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.Clear
member.summary: Clear the string. Doesn't change the protection level.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.EnableProtection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Change the protection level (protect or don't protect). Note: you only need to call this function if you really want to change the protection. If you specified the protection flag in the constructor, and don't want to change it, you don't need to call this function.
member.param: If true, the string will be protected (encrypted in-memory). Otherwise the string will be stored in plain-text in the process memory.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.SetString(System.String)
member.summary: Assign a new string value to the object.
member.param: New string. The string must not contain a null terminator.
member.exception: Thrown if the input parameter is null.
Thrown if the new string contains a null terminator.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.ReadString
member.summary: Convert the protected string to a normal string object. Be careful with this function, the returned string object isn't protected any more and stored in plain-text in the process memory.
member.returns: Plain-text string. Is never null.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.ReadUtf8
member.summary: Read out the string and return a byte array that contains the string encoded using UTF-8. The returned string is not protected anymore!
member.returns: Plain-text UTF-8 byte array.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.ReadXorredString(KeePassLib.Cryptography.CryptoRandomStream)
member.summary: Read the protected string and return it protected with a sequence of bytes generated by a random stream. The object's data will be invisible in process memory only if the object has been initialized using a XorredBuffer. If no XorredBuffer has been used or the string has been read once already (in plain-text), the operation won't be secure and the protected string will be visible in process memory.
member.param: Random number source.
member.returns: Protected string.
member.exception: Thrown if the input parameter is null.

member.name: P:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.IsProtected
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the ProtectedString object has turned on in-memory protection or not.

member.name: P:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.IsViewable
member.summary: A value specifying whether the ProtectedString object is currently in-memory protected or not. This flag can be different than IsProtected: if a XorredBuffer is used, the IsProtected flag represents the memory protection flag, but not the actual protection. In this case use IsViewable, which returns true if a XorredBuffer is currently in use.

member.name: T:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary

member.summary: Construct a new protected binary data object. Copy the data from an existing object.

member.exception: Thrown if the input parameter is null.

XorredBuffer object used to initialize the ProtectedBinary object.

member.summary: Change the protection level (protect or don't protect). Note: you only need to call this function if you really want to change the protection. If you specified the protection flag in the constructor, and don't want to change it, you don't need to call this function.
member.param: If true, the data will be protected (encrypted in-memory). Otherwise the data will be stored in plain-text in the process memory.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.SetData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Set protected data. This function also clears the internal XorredBuffer object.
member.param: Data to store in the protected object. The input byte array will not be modified, the data is copied to an internal buffer of the protected object. This parameter must not be null; if you want to clear the object, call the Clear member function.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.ReadData
member.summary: Get the protected data as a byte array. Please note that the returned byte array is not protected and can therefore been read by any other applications. Make sure that your clear it properly after usage.
member.returns: Unprotected byte array. This is always a copy of the internal protected data and can therefore be cleared safely.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.ReadXorredData(KeePassLib.Cryptography.CryptoRandomStream)
member.summary: Read the protected data and return it protected with a sequence of bytes generated by a random stream. The object's data will be invisible in process memory only if the object has been initialized using a XorredBuffer. If no XorredBuffer has been used or the binary has been read once already (in plain-text), the operation won't be secure and the protected string will be visible in process memory.
member.param: Random number source.
member.returns: Protected data.
member.exception: Thrown if the input parameter is null.

member.name: P:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.IsProtected
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the ProtectedBinary object has turned on in-memory protection or not.

member.name: P:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.IsViewable
member.summary: A value specifying whether the ProtectedString object is currently in-memory protected or not. This flag can be different than IsProtected: if a XorredBuffer is used, the IsProtected flag represents the memory protection flag, but not the actual protection. In this case use IsViewable, which returns true if a XorredBuffer is currently in use.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.PwGroup.TraverseTree(KeePassLib.TraversalMethod,KeePassLib.Delegates.GroupHandler,KeePassLib.Delegates.EntryHandler)
member.summary: Traverse the group/entry tree in the current group. Various traversal methods are available.
member.param: Specifies the traversal method.

Function that performs an action on the currently visited group (see GroupHandler for more). This parameter may be null, in this case the tree is traversed but you don't get notifications for each visited group.
Function that performs an action on the currently visited entry (see EntryHandler for more). This parameter may be null.
member.returns: Returns true if all entries and groups have been traversed. If the traversal has been canceled by one of the two handlers, the return value is false.

member.name: T:KeePassLib.Security.XorredBuffer
member.summary: Represents an object that is encrypted using a XOR pad until it is read. The key XOR pad can be changed without revealing the protected data in process memory.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.XorredBuffer.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Construct a new XOR-protected object using a protected byte array and a XOR pad that decrypts the protected data. The byte array must have the same size as the byte array.
member.param: Protected data (XOR pad applied).
XOR pad that is used to decrypt the parameter.
member.exception: Thrown if one of the input parameters is null.
Thrown if the byte arrays are of different size.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.XorredBuffer.ReadPlainText
member.summary: Decrypt the buffer. The XorredBuffer protection is useless after you used this method. The object cannot be re-encrypted.
member.returns: Unprotected plain-text byte array.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.XorredBuffer.ChangeKey(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Change the protection key for this XorredBuffer object. The data will first be decrypted using the old key and then re-encrypted using the new key. This operation doesn't reveal the plain-text in the process memory.
member.param: New protection pad. Must contain exactly the same number of bytes as the length of the currently protected data. Use the Length property of the XorredBuffer to query the data length and pass a correct number of bytes to ChangeKey.
member.returns: New protected data (encrypted using the new XOR pad).
member.exception: Thrown if the input parameter is null.
Thrown if the input byte array doesn't have the correct size.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.XorredBuffer.XorArrays(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: XOR all bytes in a data buffer with a pad. Both byte arrays must be of the same size.
member.param: Data to be protected.
XOR pad.
member.exception: Thrown if one of the parameters is null.
Thrown if the length of the data array and the pad aren't equal.

member.name: P:KeePassLib.Security.XorredBuffer.Length
member.summary: Length of the protected data in bytes.
